location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter no.14 of 1852 from Major Atkins Hamerton, HM's Consul and Honourable Company's Agent in the Dominions of His Highness the Imam of Muskat, to Arthur Malet, Chief Secretary to the Government Bombay

mods.abstract: Hamerton reports on the grounding of the British ship Centaur, which occurred in thick fog on 4 May 1852. He states that the next morning the 'natives' threatened to kill all crew if they did not leave the vessel. The crew arrived 'destitute' at the Muscat Agency on 19 May. The Centauris reported to have been completely plundered and burned, with the loss of insured cargo (including indigo) worth twelve lacs of rupees. Hamerton states that the forty-seven crew members of the Centaurare in Muscat, awaiting passage to Bombay.
